intro: Chiritopsis xiuningensis, commonly known as the Xiuning chiritopsis, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
